intro: Sorghum contortum, commonly known as twisted sorghum, is a perennial grass native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its twisted, coiled inflorescence, which gives it its common name. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters and has narrow, grass-like leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to dry climates. Sorghum contortum is often found in open woodlands and along stream banks.
